  16. ‌#define CAML_INTERNALS

  18. /* Print an uncaught exception and abort */

  20. #include <stdio.h>
  21. #include <stdlib.h>
  22. #include <string.h>
  23. #include "caml/backtrace.h"
  24. #include "caml/callback.h"
  25. #include "caml/debugger.h"
  26. #include "caml/fail.h"
  27. #include "caml/misc.h"
  28. #include "caml/mlvalues.h"
  29. #include "caml/printexc.h"
  30. #include "caml/memory.h"
  31. #include "caml/memprof.h"

  33. ‌struct stringbuf {
  34.   char * ptr;
  35.   char * end;
  36.   char data[256];
  37. };

  39. ‌static void add_char(struct stringbuf *buf, char c)
  40. {
  41.   if (buf->ptr < buf->end) *(buf->ptr++) = c;
  42. }

  44. ‌static void add_string(struct stringbuf *buf, const char *s)
  45. {
  46.   size_t len = strlen(s);
  47.   if (buf->ptr + len > buf->end) len = buf->end - buf->ptr;
  48.   if (len > 0) memmove(buf->ptr, s, len);
  49.   buf->ptr += len;
  50. }

  52. ‌CAMLexport char * caml_format_exception(value exn)
  53. {
  54.   Caml_check_caml_state();
  55.   mlsize_t start, i;
  56.   value bucket, v;
  57.   struct stringbuf buf;
  58.   char intbuf[64];
  59.   char * res;

  61.   buf.ptr = buf.data;
  62.   buf.end = buf.data + sizeof(buf.data) - 1;
  63.   if (Tag_val(exn) == 0) {
  64.     add_string(&buf, String_val(Field(Field(exn, 0), 0)));
  65.     /* Check for exceptions in the style of Match_failure and Assert_failure */
  66.     if (Wosize_val(exn) == 2 &&
  67.         Is_block(Field(exn, 1)) &&
  68.         Tag_val(Field(exn, 1)) == 0 &&
  69.         caml_is_special_exception(Field(exn, 0))) {
  70.       bucket = Field(exn, 1);
  71.       start = 0;
  72.     } else {
  73.       bucket = exn;
  74.       start = 1;
  75.     }
  76.     add_char(&buf, '(');
  77.     for (i = start; i < Wosize_val(bucket); i++) {
  78.       if (i > start) add_string(&buf, ", ");
  79.       v = Field(bucket, i);
  80.       if (Is_long(v)) {
  81.         snprintf(intbuf, sizeof(intbuf),
  82.                  "%" ARCH_INTNAT_PRINTF_FORMAT "d", Long_val(v));
  83.         add_string(&buf, intbuf);
  84.       } else if (Tag_val(v) == String_tag) {
  85.         add_char(&buf, '"');
  86.         add_string(&buf, String_val(v));
  87.         add_char(&buf, '"');
  88.       } else {
  89.         add_char(&buf, '_');
  90.       }
  91.     }
  92.     add_char(&buf, ')');
  93.   } else
  94.     add_string(&buf, String_val(Field(exn, 0)));

  96.   *buf.ptr = 0;              /* Terminate string */
  97.   i = buf.ptr - buf.data + 1;
  98.   res = caml_stat_alloc_noexc(i);
  99.   if (res == NULL) return NULL;
  100.   memmove(res, buf.data, i);
  101.   return res;
  102. }


  105. #ifdef NATIVE_CODE
  106. ‌#  define DEBUGGER_IN_USE 0
  107. #else
  108. ‌#  define DEBUGGER_IN_USE caml_debugger_in_use
  109. #endif

  111. /* Default C implementation in case the OCaml one is not registered. */
  112. ‌static void default_fatal_uncaught_exception(value exn)
  113. {
  114.   char * msg;
  115.   const value * at_exit;
  116.   int saved_backtrace_active, saved_backtrace_pos;

  118.   /* Build a string representation of the exception */
  119.   msg = caml_format_exception(exn);
  120.   /* Perform "at_exit" processing, ignoring all exceptions that may
  121.      be triggered by this */
  122.   saved_backtrace_active = Caml_state->backtrace_active;
  123.   saved_backtrace_pos = Caml_state->backtrace_pos;
  124.   Caml_state->backtrace_active = 0;
  125.   at_exit = caml_named_value("Pervasives.do_at_exit");
  126.   if (at_exit != NULL) caml_callback_exn(*at_exit, Val_unit);
  127.   Caml_state->backtrace_active = saved_backtrace_active;
  128.   Caml_state->backtrace_pos = saved_backtrace_pos;
  129.   /* Display the uncaught exception */
  130.   fprintf(stderr, "Fatal error: exception %s\n", msg);
  131.   caml_stat_free(msg);
  132.   /* Display the backtrace if available */
  133.   if (Caml_state->backtrace_active && !DEBUGGER_IN_USE)
  134.     caml_print_exception_backtrace();
  135. }

  137. ‌int caml_abort_on_uncaught_exn = 0; /* see afl.c */

  139. ‌void caml_fatal_uncaught_exception(value exn)
  140. {
  141.   const value *handle_uncaught_exception;

  143.   handle_uncaught_exception =
  144.     caml_named_value("Printexc.handle_uncaught_exception");

  146.   if (handle_uncaught_exception != NULL)
  147.     /* [Printexc.handle_uncaught_exception] does not raise exception. */
  148.     caml_callback2(*handle_uncaught_exception, exn, Val_bool(DEBUGGER_IN_USE));
  149.   else
  150.     default_fatal_uncaught_exception(exn);
  151.   /* Terminate the process */
  152.   if (caml_abort_on_uncaught_exn) {
  153.     abort();
  154.   } else {
  155.     exit(2);
  156.   }
  157. }
